title: 125+ Good Morning Messages & Quotes to Send to a Friend

steps.title: Help a friend feel loved with a simple but charming message.
steps.content: Help a friend feel loved with a simple but charming message. Let your bestie know you’re thinking of them with a sweet, good morning text . Not only will they smile, but they’ll feel supported. “Sending you a virtual cup of coffee to start your day! Good morning!” “Good morning, friend! I hope you had a good night’s sleep.” “Life is so much more fun with a friend like you! I hope you have a great day!” “Good morning, friend! Don’t let anything pull you down today.” “May your day be full of unforgettable memories, dear friend.” “Hi, bestie! Wishing you a morning full of love and positivity.” “Sending a warm, good morning wish to you this morning, friend.” “May every morning shower you with blessings. Good morning, friend!” “Wishing a good morning to my bestest of friends.” “Hoping you have a cheerful morning!” “Sending so much love your way this morning, friend!” “Good morning, pal! Never forget that you are deserving of all of life’s love.” “May you have a day full of achievements and success.” “I hope you woke up with a smile on your face because I love you so much!” “May your day start with a cheerful and blessed morning.” “Good morning, my motivator! You inspire me to keep going. Here’s to another day!” “Sending all the love and positive vibes your way this morning!” “I hope everything comes easy today!” [1] X Research source “Good morning, friend! Wishing you an amazing day ahead.” “I hope your morning brings you nothing but luck and happiness.” “Good morning, friend! I just wanted to let you know that I’m thinking of you.” “Good morning, pal! Can’t wait to see you later! Have a great day!” “Hello, sunshine! May this morning bring you nothing but good things.” “Rise and shine, friend! Hope you had a great sleep.” “To my wonderful friend, have a wonderful day!” “Good morning, dear friend! I am grateful for you each and every day.”

steps.title: Start a friend’s day with a text that’ll make them smile.
steps.content: Start a friend’s day with a text that’ll make them smile. An endearingly cute text can do wonders for your friend’s mood! Keep it simple but sweet, and they’re sure to feel loved. Check out these examples for inspiration: “Good morning! How did you sleep?” “Hoping your day starts with a perfect cup of coffee and plenty of dog cuddles!” “The birds are chirping, friend! Let’s go out and enjoy the day!” “Have an awesome day, dear friend!” “Hoping your morning brings a smile to your face!” “May today be full of sunshine and rainbows!” “Sending love and positivity to you this morning, my dear friend!” “Be a morning star and shine bright today!” “Sending special good morning wishes to the most special friend.” “Good morning, friend! May you continue to spread happiness everywhere you go.” “Good morning! Don’t forget to smile today!” “Sending you a basket full of love on this fine day!” “The sky’s awake! Hoping you are well!” “Friends like you make my days worthwhile. Have a blessed day, dear friend!” “Hoping your day is as lovely as you are!” “Good morning, my friend! I hope your day is as bright as your spirit!” “May the sun shine on you all day long.” “Wake up, sleeping beauty! Today is the day you take over the world!” [2] X Research source “Do you know why the sun rises every morning? It wants to see you smile once more!” “Good morning! Let’s start the day with a sprinkle of laughter and a splash of silliness.” “Good morning, buddy! The world is waiting for you!” “Have a super day, dear friend!” “Time to embrace another day! Sending all my love your way.” “May your day be full of nothing but success.” “Good morning, friend! Today is your day. Make the most of it!”

steps.title: Make a friend laugh first thing in the morning.
steps.content: Make a friend laugh first thing in the morning. Is life putting your bestie through the wringer? Send them a text first thing in the morning that’ll make them smile no matter what! These silly messages are a perfect way to cheer them up: [3] X Research source “Don’t waste the day away! Get up, sleepyhead!” “There is so much more to do when you get up early—so wake up!” “Get up, lazy! Today is yours for the taking!” “The sky is awake. Why are you sleeping?” “Hello, sleepyhead! The morning is here, and we have much to do!” “Dear friend, here’s a reminder not to hit the snooze button because you have an amazing day ahead!” “Rise and shine, sleepyhead! Don’t stay in bed too long!” “Wake up and get ready! We’ve got things to do!” “Coffee: because adulting is hard.” “Morning mantra: I’m awake, I’m awesome, and coffee helps.” “Morning is nature’s way of saying, ‘One more time, with feeling!’” “Good morning! Time to rise and whine!” “Knock knock! Who’s there? Your personal wake-up fairy with a bucket of sunshine and giggles!” “Good morning, sleeping beauty! It’s time to get up!” “Morning! Did you know the birds were holding auditions for your morning alarm? Spoiler: they got the part.” “Good morning! Remember, your yawns are contagious. Share them wisely.” “Rumor has it your bed is protesting your absence this morning. Time to negotiate.” “Hey! Just a heads up that your coffee is plotting to wake you up today.” “Morning fun fact: You can’t look good and be a morning person at the same time. Choose wisely.” “Alert: Your alarm is now in witness protection for its own safety. Time to get up!” “Rise and sparkle! Or just rise. Sparkling is optional and highly ambitious.” “Hey! Just so you know, your blanket is plotting a cozy coup. Stay vigilant.” “Mornings are like blank canvases. Too bad I never learned to paint.” “Rise and whine, friends! It’s time to stumble through our morning routines.” “Rise and shine! Just kidding. We can grumble and glare together.” “Good morning! Today’s agenda: trying to be morning. We got this!”

steps.title: Start your bestie’s day off right with an uplifting message.
steps.content: Start your bestie’s day off right with an uplifting message. Help your pal start their day on a positive note with a message that inspires and motivates. Speak from the heart, and you can’t go wrong! Here are some examples: “Today is a blank page. Let’s write an epic story.” “Make the most of the morning, friend! Today is yours for the taking.” “The sun is shining—it’s a new day! I believe in you!” “May your happiness and success have no boundaries. Go conquer the day!” “It’s a new day! You have the opportunity to make it something special.” “Life is what we make of it. Go out there and make it great.” “Another beautiful day to remind you to move on and make the most out of life.” “Don’t let the clouds from yesterday cloud your today.” “Mornings give us the chance to chase our dreams.” “It’s never too late to begin. Wake up and start your journey.” “You have the power to be the change you wish for. Be the change today.” “As the sun rises, may you feel motivated to get through the day.” “Today is a blank canvas. Let’s paint it with beautiful colors.” “Life is tough, but so are you. Go out there and conquer the day.” “As the sun rises, may it bring you the courage to chase your dreams.” “Rise and shine! Remember, every morning is a new beginning.” “Morning! Remember to embrace the day with a positive mindset.” “Here’s your daily reminder that you’re amazing. Shine bright today!” “Good morning! Each accomplishment starts with a small step. Keep moving forward!” “Here’s to a day filled with lots of laughter, joy, and endless opportunities.” “Here comes another day to live life to the fullest. Make every moment count!” “Good morning, friend! Your positivity is contagious, so go out and spread it!” “Cheers to a new day full of brightness! You deserve it.” “May the morning colors paint your life.” “New day, new challenges! You got this!” “Whether it’s a good or bad day, you can make it better.”

steps.title: Send an inspiring quote to motivate a friend.
steps.content: Send an inspiring quote to motivate a friend. Don’t know what to say in your good morning text? No worries! Borrow inspiration from your friend’s favorite celebrity or public figure. These quotes are perfect for morning motivation: [4] X Research source “Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year.” - Ralph Waldo Emerson “I get up every morning, and it’s going to be a great day. You never know when it’s going to be over, so I refuse to have a bad day.” - Paul Henderson “Every morning, I wake up saying, ‘I’m still alive, a miracle.’ And so I keep on pushing.” - Jim Carrey “If you’re changing the world, you’re working on important things. You’re excited to get up in the morning.” - Larry Page “When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive, to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.” - Marcus Aurelius “Smile in the mirror. Do that every morning, and you’ll start to see a big difference in your life.” - Yoko Ono “Morning is an important time of day because how you spend your morning can often tell you what kind of day you are going to have.” - Lemony Snicket “Everyone has highs and lows that they have to learn from, but every morning I start off with a good head on my shoulders, saying to myself, ‘It’s going to be a good day!’” - Lindsay Lohan “I’m always thinking about creating. My future starts when I wake up every morning. Every day I find something creative to do with my life.” - Miles Davis “Lose an hour in the morning, and you will spend all day looking for it.” - Richard Whately “First thing every morning before you arise, say out loud, ‘I believe,’ three times.” - Ovid “I wake up laughing. Yes, I wake up in the morning, and there I’m just laughing my head off.” - Bruce Willis “The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.” - Walt Disney “If you get up in the morning and think the future is going to be better, it is a bright day. Otherwise, it’s not.” - Elon Musk “Every morning was a cheerful invitation to make my life of equal simplicity, and I may say innocence, with Nature herself.” - Henry David Thoreau “In these times, you have to be an optimist to open your eyes when you awake in the morning.” - Carl Sandburg “I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world.” - E.B. White “I wake up in the morning, and my heart is light, man. It’s not heavy. I don’t have skeletons in the closet on their way out.” - Drake “The breeze at dawn has secrets to tell you. Don’t go back to sleep.” - Rumi “With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.” - Eleanor Roosevelt “Morning without you is a dwindled dawn.” - Emily Dickinson “When you do something beautiful and nobody notices, do not be sad. For the sun every morning is a beautiful spectacle, and yet most of the audience still sleeps.” - John Lennon “When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.” - Henry Ford “It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.” - Confucius “The next morning dawned bright and sweet, like ribbon candy.” - Sarah Addison Allen “You may be disappointed if you daily, but you are doomed if you don’t try.” - Beverly Sills “The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.” - Nelson Mandela

steps.title: Reference a current event in your friend's life.
steps.content: Reference a current event in your friend's life. Note something specific happening in your friend’s life right now to make the message that much more personal. This is also a great way to let them know you’ve been listening to them . For example, if they have a difficult test coming up, you might text them, “Good morning! Good luck on your test today! You go this 👍” Make notes of special events your friend has coming up so you never forget to check up on them or wish them well. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Mention a shared memory.
steps.content: Mention a shared memory. Refer to something you both experienced together to make your message more personal. This is a great way to reminisce and share that you value your time together as friends. [6] X Research source For instance, you could write, “Morning, friend! It was so great seeing you last weekend. That movie was wild 🤯 Let’s do it again sometime!”

steps.title: Show an interest in their life.
steps.content: Show an interest in their life. Don’t be afraid to ask a quick question in your morning message. Maybe you saw on social media that your friend went hiking recently or picked up a new hobby. Ask them about it! This is a great way to show an interest in their life, which can help strengthen your friendship . [7] X Research source For example, you might say, “Morning, Jean! Your hiking trip this weekend looked epic! Did you reach your step goals?”

steps.title: When you’re thinking of them.
steps.content: When you’re thinking of them. If you wake up thinking about your friend, don’t hesitate to send them a quick text! Maybe you had their favorite food for breakfast or simply thought of them while watching the news. No matter the case, a simple “I thought of you” is the perfect excuse to send a morning text.

steps.title: When they’re feeling down.
steps.content: When they’re feeling down. If you know your friend’s been having a rough time lately, send them a morning text to lift their spirits. Maybe they’re having a difficult time at work or are stressed about an upcoming test. No matter the case, let them know you’re there to support them with a simple message in the morning.

steps.title: When you just want to say hi.
steps.content: When you just want to say hi. You don’t need an excuse to text your friend. If you have the urge, go for it! Something as simple as “Good morning!” can make their morning and help strengthen your friendship.
